title: Error is printed twice when --debug is enabled

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

body:
I wanted to get your thoughts on this behavior in helm / whether it's intended or not.

When making use of my [helm_error_charts](https://github.com/jessesimpson36/helm_error_charts/tree/main) example repo, and running 

```
helm template --debug test 5_deeply_nested_chart
```

The output contains 2 copies of the error message (I'll add extra newlines to make it more pronounced):

```
install.go:225: 2025-05-13 12:56:28.070458592 -0400 EDT m=+0.021712978 [debug] Original chart version: ""
install.go:242: 2025-05-13 12:56:28.070488292 -0400 EDT m=+0.021742668 [debug] CHART PATH: /home/jesse/code/jesse/helm_error_charts/5_deeply_nested_chart


Error: template: function_not_found_nested/templates/secret.yaml:6:11: executing "function_not_found_nested/templates/secret.yaml" at <include "common.name" .>: error calling include: template: function_not_found_nested/charts/common/templates/_helpers_1.tpl:3:5: executing "common.name" at <include "uncommon.name" .>: error calling include: template: function_not_found_nested/charts/common/charts/uncommon/templates/_helpers_1.tpl:3:5: executing "uncommon.name" at <include "common.names.get_name" .>: error calling include: template: no template "common.names.get_name" associated with template "gotpl"


helm.go:86: 2025-05-13 12:56:28.072596754 -0400 EDT m=+0.023851130 [debug] template: function_not_found_nested/templates/secret.yaml:6:11: executing "function_not_found_nested/templates/secret.yaml" at <include "common.name" .>: error calling include: template: function_not_found_nested/charts/common/templates/_helpers_1.tpl:3:5: executing "common.name" at <include "uncommon.name" .>: error calling include: template: function_not_found_nested/charts/common/charts/uncommon/templates/_helpers_1.tpl:3:5: executing "uncommon.name" at <include "common.names.get_name" .>: error calling include: template: no template "common.names.get_name" associated with template "gotpl"
```

I want to understand the value in having the error message twice when `--debug` is used.

## Extra details about where the error messages are located

The log line from the `--debug` output that contains the error message is located here:
https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/b2456202aedb10b0d6be5d6d320d8428bb932400/cmd/helm/helm.go#L44
And is sent to stdout

The error message that comes before it, that would be outputted even without the `--debug` flag, is set by spf13/cobra, and can be silenced by adding `SilenceErrors` inside each of the `Command` structs (ex. template.go).
And is sent to stderr.

## Possible ways this could be valuable to keep both

the debug log line is sent in a structured format, and it's possible that other applications may read and query from these types of log lines.  Yet a human is more likely to want to read the error message above it, since it would be formatted (if https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/13586 is merged). So it's possible one could be a human-readable error, and the other is expected to be machine-readable.  I'm not sure `--debug` is intended to be interpreted this way, though.  

(may add more as I think of it.)

## Things I considered

1.  Maybe it's best to set `SilenceErrors = true` when `--debug` is enabled.  
2. Maybe we just keep both error messages in
3. Maybe we just remove the debug log line, since it's redundant.
